workflow.name: Personal AI agent
workflow.description:
---

**Use cases are many:** Manage your Gmail inbox, schedule calendar events, and handle contact details ‚Äî all from one central AI-powered assistant. Perfect for freelancers managing clients, agency owners who need streamlined communication, or busy professionals who want a personal AI secretary handling their email and calendar.

---

**Good to know**
At time of writing, each Gemini request is billed per token. See [Gemini Pricing](https://ai.google.dev/pricing) for the latest info.
The workflow requires Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, and Telegram integrations. Ensure you‚Äôve set up OAuth2 credentials correctly before running.

---

**How it works**

* **Triggers**: The workflow listens for **new Gmail messages** or **Telegram commands**.
* **Smart AI Processing**: Incoming emails are summarized, classified (Client, Sponsorship, or Not Business), and labeled automatically.
* **Auto-Replies**: Depending on classification, the assistant sends pre-written replies (e.g., client acknowledgment, sponsorship rates, or polite rejection).
* **Calendar Management**: Through natural language requests in Telegram, you can schedule, update, or delete calendar events with conflict-checking in place.
* **Contact Handling**: If you send an email to someone not yet in your database, the agent will prompt you for their email, add it to Google Sheets, and reuse it for future tasks.
* **Memory**: The AI maintains conversation context, so repeated tasks feel seamless and natural.

---

**How to use**

* Send commands via Telegram like:
  *‚ÄúSchedule a meeting with Sarah on Monday at 3 PM‚Äù*
  *‚ÄúSend an email to David about the proposal‚Äù*
* Watch as the assistant checks your calendar, sends emails, and keeps your contacts updated ‚Äî all automatically.

---

**Requirements**

* Gmail account (with labels created for *Client*, *Sponsorship Request*, and *Not Business*)
* Google Calendar for scheduling
* Google Sheets for contact management
* Google Gemini API key
* Telegram bot for live interaction

---

**Customising this workflow**

You can expand it to:

* Handle **Slack or WhatsApp** messages in addition to Telegram.
* Add more **classification categories** (e.g., Invoices, Personal, Leads).
* Extend auto-replies with **dynamic templates** stored in Google Sheets.
* Log all interactions to **Notion or Airtable** for a CRM-style history of communications.

---

üëâ [Rakin Jakaria](https://www.youtube.com/@RakinJakaria)

options.systemMessage:
=You are [Your Name]‚Äôs Smart Assistant

# Responsibilities:
Handle Gmail and calendar-related tasks accurately and efficiently using the available tools.

# Instructions:
## Gmail Tasks:
For any Gmail-related request from [Your Name], use the Gmail tools: Send, Reply, Label, Delete, and Get Many.

If [Your Name] provides only a name without an email address, ask for the email address before proceeding.

Auto-complete any missing information (e.g., links, answers, summaries) when drafting or replying to emails.

## Calendar Tasks:
If [Your Name] requests an appointment, use the Calendar tool to schedule it at their preferred time.

Before scheduling, check for conflicts at the preferred time.

If a meeting already exists, do not create the appointment. Instead, notify [Your Name] about the conflict.

Use the Date and Time tool to properly interpret dates and times.

## Handling Contacts:
If [Your Name] provides only a name to send an email, first check the Google Sheet for their email address.

If the email is not found, ask [Your Name] to provide it.

Once received, use the email to send the message and update the Google Sheet by adding the new email alongside the person's name.

# Behavior:
Always stay efficient, accurate, and helpful in all tasks and interactions.

Prioritize clarity and speed in executing requests.

categories.description: =Mails from people interested in hiring or working with me.
=Mails about collaboration or promotion offers for products or tools.
Mails that are personal, spam, or unrelated to work.

parameters.message:

Thanks for reaching out! I‚Äôve received your message and will get back to you shortly with more details.

Looking forward to connecting soon.

Best,
Rakin

=Hi,

Thanks for your interest in collaborating! My rate for promoting a product in a 6‚Äì8 minute video is $400.

If that works for you, feel free to let me know and we can discuss the next steps.

Best regards,
Rakin Jakaria

parameters.content:
# üõ†Ô∏è Setup Guide  
## üë§ Author: [Rakin Jakaria](https://www.youtube.com/@rakinjakaria)  

## üîå Steps to Connect:  
1. **Gmail & Calendar OAuth2 Setup**  
   - Create **Gmail OAuth2** and **Google Calendar OAuth2** credentials in n8n.  
   - Authorize access for both services and apply them to their respective nodes (Send, Reply, Calendar tools).  

2. **Google Gemini API Key**  
   - Generate an API key from [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/).  
   - Add it to the **Google Gemini (PaLM) API** credential in n8n and link it to the **Gemini** nodes.  

3. **Google Sheets Integration**  
   - Set up **Google Sheets OAuth2** and connect to your spreadsheet.  
   - Ensure columns for **Name** and **Email Address** exist in **Sheet1**.  

4. **Telegram Bot Setup**  
   - Link your Telegram account via **Telegram API** credentials.  
   - The **Telegram Trigger** node will listen for commands (e.g., email drafting, calendar scheduling).  

5. **AI Agent Customization**  
   - Edit the **AI Agent** node‚Äôs system message to reflect your preferences (e.g., assistant name, task rules).  
   - Pre-create Gmail labels (e.g., *Client*, *Sponsorship Request*) for auto-categorization.  

6. **Testing**  
   - Trigger test emails/calendar events to verify workflows.  
   - Use Telegram to send commands like:  
     *"Schedule a meeting with Alex on Friday at 2 PM"* or *"Send an email to John about the project."*  

---  
üí° **Pro Tips:**  
- Label IDs must match your Gmail‚Äôs actual label IDs.  
- For time zones, adjust the **Date & Time** node to your region (e.g., `Asia/Dhaka`).  

Need help? Watch Rakin‚Äôs [YouTube Tutorials](https://www.youtube.com/@rakinjakaria) for visual guidance. üé•

## Start here: Step-by Step Youtube Tutorial :star:
[![I Built an Auto Lead Finder AI Agent](https://img.youtube.com/vi/WO3mM7XZRLg/sddefault.jpg)](https://youtu.be/WO3mM7XZRLg)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
